content.question: A capacitor is charged using a battery until the energy stored in the electric field between the plates is equal to <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math>. The capacitor is removed from the battery and then connected to an inductor. The time it takes for the capacitor to discharge and fully recharge with the same initial polarity is <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math>. At what time will the energy stored in the magnetic field of the inductor be equal to <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math>?

choices.label: The energy will never be equal to <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math>.
